name: WWIG
body:
## WWIG.
### What Would I Get _(if i followed you)_

Most of the stuff I want to see when I go to a Twitter timeline is drowned in a crap heap of things I _don't_ want to see.  

Often the window is filled with @tweets that I wouldn't see anyway. 

I just want to quickly glance and see what I'd get (WWIG) if I followed you.  And why not a rough estimate of how many of those tweets I'd get per day.

WWIG is just a simple bookmarklet that filters through the tweets on a Twitter timeline and fades out the ones that wouldn't cross your stream.  It also calculates some _very rudimentary_ estimates of the user's tweets/day from the twitter API.

Simple.  Just something I wished Twitter did natively.

Sue me.

Actually don't.
tagline: What Would I Get (if I followed you)
